title: Strictly's Katya Jones fires back after being accused of drunken fall
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Strictly Come Dancing star Katya Jones has fired back at fans who accused her of being drunk on the show.

A fortnight ago, the professional dancer accidentally slipped during her routine with journalist Mike Bushell.

And even though she managed to gracefully style out her fall, viewers were adamant that she had one too many ahead of the performance.

Despite already denying the claims, the 30-year-old has once again addressed the accusations, when appearing on Loose Women.

She told the panelists: ‘Yeah it’s a little bit sad, I got so many messages saying, “Oh, she is drunk, the BBC shouldn’t hire her…”‘

The star went on: ‘In the dance, it was such a normal thing, all I cared about was for him to carry on.’

Strictly’s Katya Jones fires back at fans who accused her of being drunk after fall (Picture: WENN)

She managed to style out her mistake (Picture: BBC / PA)

After the Loose Women pressed her on the fall, they then quizzed some more about last year’s controversy where Katya was pictured kissing her celeb partner Seann Walsh.

After the photos were released, the star spent Christmas with her then husband Neil Jones, before parting ways with him earlier this year.

But it turns out they’re still just as supportive of one another, despite their split.

She beamed: ‘Dancing brought us together, and you see us talking and helping each other, sending each other videos and help.

‘If people are looking for things they will always find things, but there is nothing to look for. Sadly, people will want me to slip up and I did.’

The star also addressed her relationship with Neil Jones (Picture: Getty)

Katya continued to praise her former man for finally getting a celeb partner.

‘I’m so excited,’ she insisted: ‘Finally! He has got all the credentials, he is the world champion and he’s brilliant. I’m so happy for him.’

The pro added: ‘I think he and Alex are really good partners.’

Mike also appeared alongside Katya on the show, where he revealed they will be taking on the samba this week – and it sounds as though they still have a lot of work to do.

He laughed off getting a nine in last week’s episode, saying: ‘It’s back to zero every week, the competition is more with yourself.

‘We’ve had some interesting moves, I think it could be [his favourite routine]. The great thing is we have Alfonso Ribeiro as our guest judge.’

Loose Women airs weekdays at 12.30 on ITV while Strictly continues next Saturday on BBC One.
